description.narrative: Even though information on global issues and globalization is available to Finnish audiences more than ever through social media and internet, the need for experience-based and evidence-based material on development cooperation is needed more than ever. Al so the political development in European countries in the past years has shown, that there exists a lot of intolerance and ignorance against people and phenomena in developing countries and therefore all the actors in development filed are obliged to provi de accurate and reliable information on global issues. Development education of ISF is based on informing and discussing about the causes of poverty, inequality and the basics of development cooperation and its impact on improving the conditions of life. T he audience and participants of ISF's development education are students, teachers and interested public in general who will be reached through social media, printed material and events. Cooperation is done with youth organisations and other NGOs in this f ield in Finland.
